bibliography:
1886, “Hegel’s Conception of Nature”, Mind,
11: 495–523.

1889, Moral Order and Progress: An Analysis of Ethical
Conceptions, London: Trubner & Co.
1908, Locke, London: Archibald Constable & Co.

1909–10, “Ptolemaic and Copernican Views of the Place
of Mind in The Universe”, The Hibbert Journal, 8:
47–66.

1912a, “The Method of Metaphysics; and the
Categories”, Mind, 21: 1–20.

1912b, “On Relations; and in Particular the Cognitive
Relation”, Mind, 21: 305–28.

1914, “The Basis of Realism”, Proceedings of the
British Academy, 5: 279–314.

1920, Space, Time, and Deity (2 volumes),
London: Macmillan & Co Ltd.
1921a, Spinoza and Time, London: Unwin Brothers.

1921b, “Some Explanations”, Mind, 30:
409–428.

1928, “Morality as An Art”, Journal of

1927, “Lessons from Spinoza”, Chronicon

1933, Beauty and other forms of Value, London: Macmillan
& Co.

1939, Philosophical and Literary Pieces, edited by John
Laird. London, Macmillan & Co.
